title: Positive effect of music on growth of plants is known. Is there a way to understand if plants are trying to convey a message to us? - Quora

response.answer_text: This is a research topic pursued at many places. I came across a reference with sevearal back references (http://www.ijesd.org/papers/522-CD0162.pdf ) detailing the promoting effect of music on Rosa chinensis plant.  Now to answer your question, Plants do not have regular communication organs like animals and humans. It has been found that when plants are challenged with biotic stresses like invasion of parasite etc, they convey this signal in form of salicylic acid, jasmonic acid and certain other compounds to alert and initiate defense response in distal part and other members of the community.  Further, if they are loosing on something, they show various symptoms like yellowing of leaves, protuberance, spots which can be treated accordingly by a plant pathologist.
Music (quality and quantity) does not have any effect on plants.Further plants do not convey any message to humans.  It should be clearly understood that plans do not have any cognitive properties.
